This structure was first proposed by James Watson and Francis Crick, two names which

Of course, the truth is that the discovery of the DNA double helix was really the result

In 1869, Friedrich Miescher first isolated DNA from the nuclei of cells.
It was this biological source which prompted him to name it nucleon, a name which was later

Russian researcher Phoebus Levine was able to identify the individual components of DNA,

But he lacked the necessary tools to properly explain exactly how each of these pieces came
together to form a structure for DNA.
In the 1940s, Erwin Chargaff developed a method for isolating the bases from DNA samples,

number of guanine bases.
He also determined that the number of adenine bases closely tracked that of thymine.
In the 1950s, the X-ray crystallography lab of Maurice Wilkins and Rosalind Franklin at
